result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry L. Mustache was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Henry L. Mustache is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Henry L. Mustache was found guilty of Incest, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.06.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 4/21/17.  Defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Paid in full from bond file.   IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment, acceptable to his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means,  with the victim, DEM, her residence or place of employment.  Obey all no contact orders of this agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Undergo a sex offender assessment, and comply with the recommendations.  Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registration law.

records.addlTxt: JOC is summarily affirmed.

Defendant appears in person in custody without counsel present.  Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Motions for withdrawal of plea or re-sentencing.  Defendant states he has not received DA Diehn's response to his motion.  State provided a printed copy to him.  Defendant presents his argument to the Court.  State  gives her argument against his motion.  

Court reviews the charge and potential penalties on the charge he was convicted on, Count 2 - Incest.  There are no grounds in the motion to withdraw his plea.  Court believes the sentence is also appropriate as ordered.  Reviewed the other charge, Count 1, and potential penalties that was dismissed outright and that can be considered during sentencing according to State vs Frye.  Court denies both motions.  His JOC was amended 4-21-17 to allow him to get substance abuse programming which a portion of his confinement time could be converted to extended supervision.  ADA Hynek will draft an order.
Motion to Modify Sentence June 15, 2018 at 9:00 a.m.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Parties have the PSI.  Defense noted corrections.  Page 11, 5th full para.  9/29/08, should be 9/29/88.  Page 29, last sentence.  Unfair summary of his statement to the probation officer.  Page 30, unfair summary of his statements.  State recommended:  4 years total.   2 years initial confinement, and  2 years extended supervision.  No contact with the vicitm.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA assessment and recommended treatment.  Sex offender assessment and follow treatment recommendations.  $60.00 restitution, plus surcharges.  Attorney Gardner recommended:  2 years probation.  Conditional jail after November when he is off work.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  9 years total.   4 years initial confinement, and 5 years extended supervision.  No contact with the vicitm, DEM her residence or place of employment.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA assessment and recommended treatment.  Sex offender assessment and follow treatment recommendations. Comply with WI sex offender law.  Obey all no contact orders of his agent.  Obtain and maintain employment, approved by his agent.  5 days credit.   $60.00 restitution, plus surcharges.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  Take costs from bond and refund balance to poster.  Not eligible for SAP or CIP.
Restitution Worksheet
e-mailed to Judge Goodman's JA.  Paper copies to the attorneys

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2.  Count 1 to be dismissed outright.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he plead to. Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of incest, contrary to 944.06 Wis. Stats. Count 1 dismissed.  PSI ordered due July 1, 2016.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Gardner and Judge Goodman appeared by telephone.  Case is settled.  Plea hearing set for 5/13/16 at 4 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
